title: 109_hr5939
content: The Act may be cited as the "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" and includes provisions related to terrorist offenses resulting in death. SEC. 2 of the "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" introduces a new offense, Sec. 2339E, which punishes individuals who cause death while committing a terrorist offense. The term 'terrorist offense' is defined broadly to include various felony offenses and attempts or conspiracies to commit such offenses. SEC. 3 introduces the death penalty for specific terror-related crimes, including threats involving nuclear weapons, missile systems, atomic weapons, radiological dispersal devices, and the variola virus. SEC. 4 increases penalties for these offenses. SEC. 4 increases penalties for specific terror-related crimes by amending various sections of title 18, United States Code to increase the maximum imprisonment terms. SEC. 5 modernizes the state of mind requirement for certain offenses, and SEC. 6 addresses providing material support to terrorist groups. SEC. 5 amends Section 2339C of title 18, United States Code, by changing the state of mind requirement to "knowingly." SEC. 6 increases penalties for providing material support to terrorist groups and receiving military-type training from a foreign terrorist organization. SEC. 7 denies federal benefits to convicted terrorists. SEC. 7 amends Chapter 113B of title 18, United States Code, to deny Federal benefits to individuals convicted of Federal crimes of terrorism. SEC. 8 amends wiretap predicate in title 18, United States Code by updating the reference to chapter 113B. SEC. 9 adds attempts and conspiracies to an offense related to military training in title 18, United States Code.
